risks.name: NetPolicyTimeoutsHostNetworkedPodTraffic
risks.message:
Clusters where Ingress Controller uses HostNetwork endpoint publishing strategy and certain NetworkPolicy configurations
may experience network traffic disruptions in namespaces that allowed traffic before the upgrade.

promql.promql:
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal|VSphere|OpenStack|Nutanix|Libvirt|KubeVirt|EquinixMetal|External"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on (_id) group_left (resource)
topk by (_id) (1,
  group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="networkpolicies.networking.k8s.io"}[1h]) > 0)
  or
  0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h]))
)

risks.name: ConsoleImplicitlyEnabled
risks.message: Clusters with the Console capability disabled will have it implicitly enabled by updating to the target release, and once enabled, capabilities cannot be disabled.

promql.promql: 1 - max(cluster_version_capability{name="Console"})

risks.name: NetworkNodeIdentityWebhookUserConflict
risks.message: Possible webhook user conflicts when updating standalone (not Hosted/HyperShift) clusters out of the target release and into one with a fix for the https://issues.redhat.com/browse/OCPBUGS-20104 series.

promql.promql:
0 * group by (invoker) (cluster_installer{_id="",invoker="hypershift"})
or on ()
group by (invoker) (cluster_installer{_id=""})
or on ()
group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h]))

risks.name: PreRelease
risks.message: This is a prerelease version, and you should update to 4.14.0 or later releases, even if that means updating to a newer 4.13 first.

risks.name: MultiNetworkAttachmentsWhereaboutsVersion
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that have multiple network attachments.

promql.promql: group(network_attachment_definition_instances > 0) or 0 * group(network_attachment_definition_instances)

risks.name: LeakedMachineConfigBlocksMCO
risks.message: Machine Config Operator stalls when encountering orphaned KubeletConfig or ContainerRuntimeConfig resources.

risks.name: AWSCustomDomainNodesNotReady
risks.message: Nodes on AWS with custom domain names will go to NotReady state.

promql.promql:
(
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="AWS"})
  or
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)

risks.name: AzureRegistryImagePreservation
risks.message: In Azure clusters, the in-cluster image registry may fail to preserve images on update.

promql.promql:
topk(1,
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="Azure"})
  or
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on () group_left (name, operation, method)
topk(1,
  group by (name) (cluster_operator_conditions{_id="",name="aro"})
  or
  group by (operation) (max by (operation) (max_over_time(imageregistry_request_duration_seconds_count{_id=""}[1h])))
  or
  0 * group by (method) (max by (method) (imageregistry_http_request_duration_seconds_count{_id=""}))
)

risks.name: CephCapDropPanic
risks.message: Nodes in clusters running workloads that mount Ceph volumes may experience kernel panics due to a CephFS client bug.

promql.promql:
topk(1,
  label_replace(group(ceph_health_status{_id=""}), "ceph", "yes", "", "")
  or
  label_replace(0 * group(cluster_version{_id=""}), "ceph", "no", "", "")
)

risks.name: HighNodeStatusReportFrequency
risks.message: An unintended reversion to the default kubelet nodeStatusReportFrequency can cause significant load on the control plane.

risks.name: IngressDegradedOnRouterReloads
risks.message: Incoming HTTP requests to services exposed by Routes may fail while routers reload their configuration, especially when made with Apache HTTPClient versions before 5.0. The problem is more likely to occur in clusters with higher number of Routes and corresponding endpoints.

risks.name: AWSCustomDomainNodesNotReady
risks.message: Nodes on AWS with custom domain names will go to NotReady state.

promql.promql:
(
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="AWS"})
  or
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)

  or

risks.name: OVNKubeMasterDSPrestop
risks.message: Upgrades can get stuck on OVN clusters that were installed as 4.10 or earlier.

promql.promql: topk(1, label_replace(group(cluster_version{type="initial",version=~"4[.]([0-9]|10)[.].*"}),"born_by_4_10", "yes, born in 4.10 or earlier", "", "") or label_replace(0 * group(cluster_version{type="initial",version!~"4[.]([0-9]|10)[.].*"}),"born_by_4_10", "no, born in 4.11 or later", "", "") ) * on () group_left(resource) ( group by (resource) (max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="egressips.k8s.ovn.org"}[1h])) or on () 0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h])) )

risks.name: AROBrokenDNSMasq
risks.message: Adding a new worker node will fail for clusters running on ARO.

promql.promql:
(
  group(cluster_operator_conditions{name="aro"})
  or
  0 * group(cluster_operator_conditions)
)

risks.name: AWSMintModeWithoutCredentials
risks.message: AWS clusters in Mint mode where the Secret with AWS credentials has been removed are not able to finish update.

promql.promql:
(
  group by (mode) (cco_credentials_mode{mode="mint"})
  or
  0 * group by (mode) (cco_credentials_mode)
)
* on () group_left (type)
(
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{type="AWS"})
  or
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider)
)
* on () group_left (secret)
bottomk(1,
  0 * group by (secret) (kube_secret_info{namespace="kube-system",secret="aws-creds"})
  or
  group(kube_secret_info)
)

promql.promql:
topk(1,
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="Azure"})
  or
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on () group_left (name, operation, method)
topk(1,
  group by (name) (cluster_operator_conditions{_id="",name="aro"})
  or
  group by (operation) (max by (operation) (max_over_time(imageregistry_request_duration_seconds_count{_id=""}[1h])))
  or
  0 * group by (method) (max by (method) (imageregistry_http_request_duration_seconds_count{_id=""}))
)

risks.name: IngressDegradedOnRouterReloads
risks.message: Incoming HTTP requests to services exposed by Routes may fail while routers reload their configuration, especially when made with Apache HTTPClient versions before 5.0. The problem is more likely to occur in clusters with higher number of Routes and corresponding endpoints.

risks.name: AWSCustomDomainNodesNotReady
risks.message: Nodes on AWS with custom domain names will go to NotReady state.

promql.promql:
(
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="AWS"})
  or
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)

risks.name: AWSECRLegacyCredProvider
risks.message: AWS clusters that use AmazonEC2ContainerRegistryReadOnly node policies to access ECR are unable to pull images from ECR after updating to exposed 4.14.z.

risks.name: AzureDefaultVMType
risks.message: Azure clusters created by openshift-installer prior to 4.9 are unable to add load balancers to new machines after updating to exposed 4.14.z.

risks.name: AzureRegistryImagePreservation
risks.message: In Azure clusters, the in-cluster image registry may fail to preserve images on update.

promql.promql:
topk(1,
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="Azure"})
  or
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on () group_left (name, operation, method)
topk(1,
  group by (name) (cluster_operator_conditions{_id="",name="aro"})
  or
  group by (operation) (max by (operation) (max_over_time(imageregistry_request_duration_seconds_count{_id=""}[1h])))
  or
  0 * group by (method) (max by (method) (imageregistry_http_request_duration_seconds_count{_id=""}))
)

risks.name: ConsoleImplicitlyEnabled
risks.message: Clusters with the Console capability disabled will have it implicitly enabled by updating to the target release, and once enabled, capabilities cannot be disabled.

promql.promql: 1 - max(cluster_version_capability{name="Console"})

risks.name: PreRelease
risks.message: This is a prerelease version, and you should update to 4.14.0 or later releases, even if that means updating to a newer 4.13 first.

risks.name: MultiNetworkAttachmentsWhereaboutsVersion
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that have multiple network attachments.

promql.promql: group(network_attachment_definition_instances > 0) or 0 * group(network_attachment_definition_instances)

risks.name: CephCapDropPanic
risks.message: Nodes in clusters running workloads that mount Ceph volumes may experience kernel panics due to a CephFS client bug.

promql.promql:
topk(1,
  label_replace(group(ceph_health_status{_id=""}), "ceph", "yes", "", "")
  or
  label_replace(0 * group(cluster_version{_id=""}), "ceph", "no", "", "")
)

risks.name: HighNodeStatusReportFrequency
risks.message: An unintended reversion to the default kubelet nodeStatusReportFrequency can cause significant load on the control plane.

risks.name: AWSCustomDomainNodesNotReady
risks.message: Nodes on AWS with custom domain names will go to NotReady state.

risks.name: NetworkNodeIdentityWebhookUserConflict
risks.message: Possible webhook user conflicts when updating standalone (not Hosted/HyperShift) clusters out of the target release and into one with a fix for the https://issues.redhat.com/browse/OCPBUGS-20104 series.

promql.promql:
0 * group by (invoker) (cluster_installer{_id="",invoker="hypershift"})
or on ()
group by (invoker) (cluster_installer{_id=""})
or on ()
group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h]))

risks.name: PreRelease
risks.message: This is a prerelease version, and you should update to 4.14.0 or later releases, even if that means updating to a newer 4.13 first.

risks.name: AzureRegistryImageMigrationUserProvisioned
risks.message: In Azure clusters with the user-provisioned registry storage, the in-cluster image registry component may struggle to complete the cluster update.

promql.promql:
topk(1,
  group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="Azure"})
  or
  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on () group_left (secret)
topk(1,
  group by (secret) (kube_secret_info{_id="",namespace="openshift-image-registry",secret="image-registry-private-configuration-user"})
  or
  0 * group by (secret) (kube_secret_info{_id="",namespace="openshift-image-registry"})
)

risks.name: ConsoleAvailableUpdatesNull
risks.message: An administrator console regression breaks the cluster settings page when 'availableUpdates' is null and 'Upgradeable' is 'False'.  You can still use 'oc adm upgrade', address the 'Upgradeable' issues, or wait for a fixed release.
